required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Effect of Sound Healing on Pain, Fatigue and Mood
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Effect of Sound Healing on Pain, Fatigue and Mood: A Retrospective Community Based Study

brief_summary.textblock: There is evidence that sound healing improves health and well-being. However, sound healing modalities, such as tuning forks, continue to be understudied, especially among people with chronic illnesses. This study examined responses to a single session of sound healing and explored whether responses varied based on analogue pain, fatigue, and mood.

primary_outcome.description: Visual Analogical Scale (VAS) from 0 to 10 scores where 0 describes no pain and 10 worst pain.

Visual Analogue Scale for Fatigue (VAS-F) with18 items relating to the subjective experience of fatigue, with each item representing how they currently feel along a visual analogue scale extending between two extremes (e.g., "not at all tired" to "extremely tired").
Visual Analogue Mood Scale using vertical 100 mm lines and schematic faces representing the following mood states: sad, afraid, angry, tired, energetic, happy, and confused.

secondary_outcome.description: Patients Satisfaction was measured using 5-Linkert Scale (Very dissatisfied, Somewhat dissatisfied, Neutral, Somewhat satisfied, Very satisfied)

arm_group.description: Community based group 'Tuning for Health' was set up to provide chronic condition self-management support to people. Trained, experienced therapist-led group used half an hour of sound healing in virtual session.

intervention.description: Over the course of a half-hour virtual session, a specially developed "triple OM track" created by tuning forks was played.

study_pop.textblock: People aged between 18-85, having long term illnesses for more than 6-month, completed 30-mins selected sound healing track with tuning forks virtually and shared their impact post session, were evaluated retrospectively.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- People with long term illnesses who attended 'Tuning for Health' virtual session
Exclusion Criteria:
- Who did not complete 30-mins Sound Healing
